name: samp
content:
Add to word list
Add to word list
dried maize (= the yellow seeds of a tall plant) that is boiled and eaten: He boiled up some samp and a few scraps of meat. Early American settlers often kept a mill for grinding samp.
More examplesFewer examplesThey each got a plate of sausages served with samp and beans.The samp mill was used to turn dried corn into a coarse meal for making porridge.When they were making samp, they did not have to grind the corn as finely as they did when they made bread.
